glsa.title: ClamAV: Remote execution of arbitrary code
glsa.synopsis: ClamAV is vulnerable to a buffer overflow which may lead to remote execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: ClamAV is a GPL virus scanner.

description.p: Zero Day Initiative (ZDI) reported a heap buffer overflow vulnerability. The vulnerability is due to an incorrect boundary check of the user-supplied data prior to copying it to an insufficiently sized memory buffer. The flaw occurs when the application attempts to handle compressed UPX files.

impact.p: For example by sending a maliciously crafted UPX file into a mail server that is integrated with ClamAV, a remote attacker's supplied code could be executed with escalated privileges.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.
